Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Specialize \Spe"cial*ize\, v. t. 1. To mention specially; to particularize. [1913 Webster]
2. To apply to some specialty or limited object; to assign to a specific use; as, specialized knowledge. [1913 Webster]
3. (Biol.) To supply with an organ or organs having a special function or functions. [1913 Webster]

specialize v 1: become more special; "We specialize in dried flowers" [syn: {specialise}, {narrow}, {narrow down}] [ant: {diversify}, {diversify}] 2: be specific about; "Could you please specify your criticism of my paper?" [syn: {specify}, {particularize}, {particularise}, {specialise}] [ant: {generalize}] 3: suit to a special purpose; "specialize one's research" [syn: {specialise}] 4: devote oneself to a special area of work; "She specializes in honey bees"; "This plumber specialized in jacuzzis" [syn: {specialise}] 5: evolve so as to lead to a new species or develop in a way most suited to the environment [syn: {speciate}, {differentiate}, {specialise}]
